Idempotent.AspNetCore/index.html.title: 🌐 Idempotent.AspNetCore | Idempotent
Idempotent.AspNetCore/index.html.summary: 🌐 Idempotent.AspNetCore Idempotent.AspNetCore integrates the Idempotent.Core with ASP.NET Core using middleware, endpoint metadata, and dependency injection. This package translates HTTP requests into idempotent transactions and replays responses when applicable. The store implementation is resolved using keyed DI. 🧬 Characteristics Intercept HTTP requests using middleware Capture request and response bodies safely Enforce idempotent behavior at runtime Replay completed responses Integrate with ASP.NET Core routing and DI ⚙️ Configuration The middleware is registered explicitly with: Supported HTTP methods Header key for idempotency Request/response size limits Truncation behavior 🎯 Who / Where Should Use This Package ASP.NET Core APIs Minimal APIs Applications requiring safe retries for non-idempotent HTTP methods 🚀 Quickstart Install Package dotnet add package Idempotent.AspNetCore Setup Store (at least one) Idempotent.InMemory Idempotent.Redis Idempotent.SqlServer Idempotent.DynamoDb Register Services builder.Services.AddIdempotentServices( storeKey: "default", headerKey: "Idempotent-Key", bufferThresholdBytes: 32_768 // Threshold Upper Bound: 32 x 1_024 = 32_768 (32 KB) ); Register Middleware builder.BuildIdempotentMiddleware( methods: [ "POST", "PATCH" ], headerKey: "Idempotent-Key", forceContinueWithoutIdempotent: false, bufferThresholdBytes: 32_768, // Threshold Upper Bound: 32 x 1_024 = 32_768 (32 KB) requestBodyLimitBytes: 524_288, // Limit Upper Bound: 512 x 1_024 = 524_288 (512 KB) responseBodyLimitBytes: 1_048_576, // Limit Upper Bound: 1_024 x 1_024 = 1_048_576 (1 MB) appendTruncatedBodyInResponse: true ); 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

Idempotent.Core/index.html.title: 📦 Idempotent.Core | Idempotent
Idempotent.Core/index.html.summary: 📦 Idempotent.Core Idempotent.Core is the foundational library that implements the core idempotency model, workflows, and persistence abstractions. It is framework-agnostic and contains no HTTP or ASP.NET dependencies. This package defines what idempotency is, how transactions behave, and how stores must implement consistency, locking, eviction, and validation. This package is not intended to be consumed directly by application code. 🧬 Characteristics Define idempotent transaction lifecycle (initiate → in-progress → completed) Enforce idempotency invariants (fingerprint consistency, time to live (ttl), replay rules) Provide concurrency control and eviction logic Expose extensible base classes for persistence providers Publish diagnostics and structured events Idempotent Transaction is uniquely identified by a composite key derived from: Service name HTTP-like method Request path Optional query string Client-provided idempotent key Fingerprinting prevents accidental replay of logically different requests under the same idempotency key. Requests are fingerprinted using: HTTP method Path + query Content type Request body stream SemaphoreSlim is used for concurrency and provides: Per-transaction locking using Lock eviction to prevent unbounded memory growth Store eviction and lock eviction run independently on intervals 🎯 Who / Where Should Use This Package Store implementers Infrastructure libraries Framework adapters (ASP.NET, gRPC, background jobs) 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

Idempotent.DynamoDb/index.html.title: ☁️ Idempotent.DynamoDb | Idempotent
Idempotent.DynamoDb/index.html.summary: ☁️ Idempotent.DynamoDb Idempotent.DynamoDb provides an idempotent store implementation backed by Amazon DynamoDB. It is designed for cloud-native, horizontally scalable systems where low-latency access and managed durability are required. This store prioritizes scalability and availability. For strict relational guarantees or cross-transaction querying, a SQL-based store may be more appropriate. 🧬 Characteristics Fully managed NoSQL persistence Horizontal scalability Native TTL-based expiration High availability without infrastructure management Relies on DynamoDB’s conditional writes for correctness Does not require distributed locks Designed to tolerate eventual consistency where safe 🎯 Use Cases Serverless APIs (AWS Lambda) Cloud-native microservices Systems requiring high availability with minimal ops overhead 🚀 Quickstart Install Package dotnet add package Idempotent.DynamoDb Register Store builder.Services.AddDynamoDbStore( storeKey: "default", serviceUrl: "http://localhost:8000", region: "us-east-1", // Optional, default value is us-east-1 tableName: "Transaction", // Optional, default value is Transaction forceInitialize: true // Optional, default value is true ); 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

Idempotent.InMemory/index.html.summary: 💾 Idempotent.InMemory Idempotent.InMemory provides a lightweight, in-memory implementation of the idempotent store. It is intended for development, testing, and low-risk scenarios. This package is to validate behavior, not durability. 🧬 Characteristics Fully in-memory No persistence across restarts Fast execution No external dependencies 🎯 Use Cases Local development Integration tests Proof-of-concept deployments ⚠️ Limitations Data loss on process restart Not suitable for distributed systems Not suitable for production workloads 🚀 Quickstart Install Package dotnet add package Idempotent.InMemory Register Store builder.Services.AddInMemoryStore( storeKey: "default" ); 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

Idempotent.Redis/index.html.title: 🗄 Idempotent.Redis | Idempotent
Idempotent.Redis/index.html.summary: 🗄 Idempotent.Redis Idempotent.Redis provides a distributed cache-backed idempotent store using Redis. It enables idempotent behavior across multiple application instances. Redis is used as a coordination and caching layer, not a relational store. 🧬 Characteristics Distributed locking Shared transaction state TTL-based eviction Redis-native expiration support 🎯 Use Cases Horizontally scaled APIs Stateless application deployments High-throughput retry-safe endpoints 🚀 Quickstart Install Package dotnet add package Idempotent.Redis Register Store builder.Services.AddRedisStore( storeKey: "default", clientName: "AspNetCoreApplication", endPoint: "localhost:6379", allowAdmin: true, abortOnConnectFail: false, // Optional, default value is false connectRetry: 5, // Optional, default value is 5 connectTimeout: 10_000, // Optional, default value is 10_000 syncTimeout: 5_000 // Optional, default value is 5_000 ); 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

Idempotent.SqlServer/index.html.title: 🛢 Idempotent.SqlServer | Idempotent
Idempotent.SqlServer/index.html.summary: 🛢 Idempotent.SqlServer Idempotent.SqlServer implements idempotent persistence using Microsoft SQL Server. It provides durable storage with strict schema validation. This store prioritizes correctness and durability over raw throughput. 🧬 Characteristics Durable persistence Strong consistency Schema validation on startup Explicit column constraints 🎯 Use Cases Enterprise systems Compliance-sensitive workloads Systems requiring auditability 🚀 Quickstart Install Package dotnet add package Idempotent.SqlServer Register Store builder.Services.AddSqlServerStore( storeKey: "default", connectionString: "Server=localhost,1433;Database=Idempotent;User Id=sa;Password=sa;TrustServerCertificate=True;Encrypt=True;", schemaName: "dbo", // Optional, default value is dbo tableName: "Transaction", // Optional, default value is Transaction forceInitialize: true // Optional, default value is true ); Storage Script If forceInitialize is set to: true: storage is initialized on startup with schemaName and tableName. false: storage must be initialized manually before startup using storage script. Names (schema, table, constraints) could differ but column names, types and lenghts must remain the same. Index is optional but recommended to improve eviction performance. CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Transaction] ( [Composite] NVARCHAR(512) NOT NULL, [Service] NVARCHAR(128) NOT NULL, [Method] INT NOT NULL, [Path] NVARCHAR(2048) NOT NULL, [Querystring] NVARCHAR(2048) NULL, [Key] NVARCHAR(256) NOT NULL, [State] INT NOT NULL, [CreatedUtc] DATETIME2 NOT NULL, [CompletedUtc] DATETIME2 NULL, [ExpiresUtc] DATETIME2 NULL, [Fingerprint] NVARCHAR(MAX) NULL, [TimeToLiveMilliseconds] INT NULL, [StatusCode] INT NULL, [Header] NVARCHAR(MAX) NULL, [Body] NVARCHAR(MAX) NULL, [OriginalBodyBytes] BIGINT NULL, [IsBodyTruncated] BIT NULL, [ExtraBodyBytes] BIGINT NULL, CONSTRAINT [PK_Transaction_Composite] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED ([Composite]) ); CREATE INDEX [IX_Transaction_ExpiresUtc] ON [dbo].[Transaction] ([ExpiresUtc]) WHERE [ExpiresUtc] IS NOT NULL"; 📘 Technical Reference See the API Reference for full technical documentation.

index.html.title: Idempotent-DotNet | Idempotent
index.html.summary: Idempotent-DotNet Idempotent.Net is a modular .NET library for implementing idempotent operations in distributed systems. It provides a small, well-defined core and multiple storage providers so applications can safely handle retries, duplicate requests, and at-least-once delivery without introducing side effects. 🧩 Packages Each of the below packages can be used independently where appropriate. Abstractions & Contracts 📦 Idempotent.Core Stores 💾 Idempotent.InMemory 🗄 Idempotent.Redis 🛢 Idempotent.SqlServer ☁️ Idempotent.DynamoDb Integration 🌐 Idempotent.AspNetCore 📘 Documentation Brief Overview Quick Start Guide Complete API Reference (DocFX-generated)
